body: # Tourmaline [![Chat on Telegram](https://patrolavia.github.io/telegram-badge/chat.png)](https://t.me/protoncr) Telegram Bot API framework written in Crystal. Based heavily off of [Telegraf](http://telegraf.js.org) this Crystal implementation allows your Telegram bot to be written in a language that's both beautiful and fast. Benchmarks coming soon. If you want to extend your bot by using NLP, see my other library [Cadmium](https://github.com/cadmiumcr). ## Installation Add this to your application's `shard.yml`: ```yaml dependencies: tourmaline: github: protoncr/tourmaline branch: master ``` ## Usage API documentation is also available [here](https://api.tourmaline.dev). Examples are available in the [examples](https://github.com/protoncr/tourmaline/branch/master/examples) folder. Just for README purposes though, let's look at the echo bot example: ```crystal require "tourmaline" class EchoBot < Tourmaline::Client @[Command("echo")] def echo_command(client, update) if message = update.message text = update.context["text"].as_s message.reply(text) end end end bot = EchoBot.new(ENV["API_KEY"]) bot.poll ``` ## Development This currently supports the following features: - [x] Client API - [x] Implementation examples - [x] Easy command syntax - [ ] Robust middleware system - [x] Standard API queries - [x] Stickers - [x] Inline mode - [x] Long polling - [x] Webhooks - [x] Payments - [x] Games - [x] Polls - [x] Telegram Passport - [x] HTTP/HTTP Proxies If you want a new feature feel free to submit an issue or open a pull request. ## Who's Using Tourmaline If you're using Tourmaline and would like to have your bot added to this list, just submit a PR! - [PixieImageBot](https://t.me/pixieimagebot) - [Utilibot](https://t.me/watzonutilitbot) ## Contributing 1. Fork it ( https://github.com/protoncr/tourmaline/fork ) 2. Create your feature branch (git checkout -b my-new-feature) 3. Commit your changes (git commit -am 'Add some feature') 4. Push to the branch (git push origin my-new-feature) 5. Create a new Pull Request ## Contributors - [watzon](https://github.com/watzon) Chris Watson - creator, maintainer

types.name: Tourmaline
types.doc:
Tourmaline handler for Kemal.

This handler allows you to use Tourmaline as a part of your
Kemal server rather than as a standalone server. This means
that webhook requests can be sent to a specific path
and handled accordingly.
types.summary: Tourmaline handler for Kemal.

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a `String` representation of this enum member.
In the case of regular enums, this is just the name of the member.
In the case of flag enums, it's the names joined by vertical bars, or "None",
if the value is zero.

If an enum's value doesn't match a member's value, the raw value
is returned as a string.

```
Color::Red.to_s                     # => "Red"
IOMode::None.to_s                   # => "None"
(IOMode::Read | IOMode::Write).to_s # => "Read | Write"

Color.new(10).to_s # => "10"
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns a String representation of this enum member.

types.name: Client
types.doc:
The `Client` class is the base class for all Tourmaline based bots.
Extend this class to create your own bots, or create an
instance of `Client` and add event handlers to it.
types.summary: The Client class is the base class for all Tourmaline based bots.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Create a new instance of `Tourmaline::Client`.

## Arguments

### Positional
- `api_key` - required; the bot token you were provided with by `@BotFather`
- `endpoint` - the Telegram bot API endpoint to use; defaults to `https://api.telegram.org`

### Named
- `persistence` - the persistence strategy to use
- `pool_capacity` - the maximum number of concurrent HTTP connections to use
- `initial_pool_size` - the number of HTTP::Client instances to create on init
- `pool_timeout` - How long to wait for a new client to be available if the pool is full before throwing a `TimeoutError`
- `proxy` - an instance of `HTTP::Proxy::Client` to use; if set, overrides the following `proxy_` args
- `proxy_uri` - a URI to use when connecting to the proxy; can be a `URI` instance or a String
- `proxy_host` - if no `proxy_uri` is provided, this will be the host for the URI
- `proxy_port` - if no `proxy_uri` is provided, this will be the port for the URI
- `proxy_user` - a username to use for a proxy that requires authentication
- `proxy_pass` - a password to use for a proxy that requires authentication
constructors.args_string: (api_key : String, endpoint = DEFAULT_API_URL, *, persistence : Persistence = NilPersistence.new, allowed_updates = [] of String, pool_capacity = 200, initial_pool_size = 20, pool_timeout = 0.1, proxy = nil, proxy_uri = nil, proxy_host = nil, proxy_port = nil, proxy_user = nil, proxy_pass = nil, log_level : ::Log::Severity = :info)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(api_key, endpoint, persistence: persistence, allowed_updates: allowed_updates, pool_capacity: pool_capacity, initial_pool_size: initial_pool_size, pool_timeout: pool_timeout, proxy: proxy, proxy_uri: proxy_uri, proxy_host: proxy_host, proxy_port: proxy_port, proxy_user: proxy_user, proxy_pass: proxy_pass, log_level: log_level)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: answer_callback_query
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to send answers to callback queries sent from
inline keyboards. The answer will be displayed to the user
as a notification at the top of the chat screen or as
an alert. On success, `true` is returned.

> Alternatively, the user can be redirected to the specified
> Game URL (`url`). For this option to work, you must first
> create a game for your bot via @Botfather and accept the
> terms. Otherwise, you may use links like
> [t.me/your_bot?start=XXXX](https://t.me/your_bot?start=XXXX)
> that open your bot with a parameter.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to send answers to callback queries sent from inline keyboards.
instance_methods.args_string: (callback_query_id, text = nil, show_alert = nil, url = nil, cache_time = nil)

def.name: answer_callback_query
def.body: request(Bool, "answerCallbackQuery", {callback_query_id: callback_query_id, text: text, show_alert: show_alert, url: url, cache_time: cache_time})

instance_methods.name: answer_inline_query
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to send answers to an inline query.
On success, True is returned. No more than
**50** results per query are allowed.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to send answers to an inline query.
instance_methods.args_string: (inline_query_id, results, cache_time = nil, is_personal = nil, next_offset = nil, switch_pm_text = nil, switch_pm_parameter = nil)

def.name: answer_inline_query
def.body: request(Bool, "answerInlineQuery", {inline_query_id: inline_query_id, results: results.to_json, cache_time: cache_time, is_personal: is_personal, next_offset: next_offset, switch_pm_text: switch_pm_text, switch_pm_parameter: switch_pm_parameter})

instance_methods.name: delete_chat_photo
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to delete a chat photo. Photos can't be changed for private chats.
The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the
appropriate admin rights.
Returns `true` on success.

> **Note:** In regular groups (non-supergroups), this method will only work if the
`All Members Are Admins` setting is off in the target group.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to delete a chat photo.

def.name: delete_chat_photo
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int::Primitive | String) ? chat : chat.id
request(Bool, "deleteChatPhoto", {chat_id: chat_id})

instance_methods.name: delete_message
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to delete a `Message`, including service messages,
with the following limitations:
- A message can only be deleted if it was sent less than 48 hours ago.
- Bots can delete outgoing messages in private chats, groups, and supergroups.
- Bots can delete incoming messages in private chats.
- Bots granted can_post_messages permissions can delete outgoing messages in channels.
- If the bot is an administrator of a group, it can delete any message there.
- If the bot has `can_delete_messages` permission in a supergroup or a
  channel, it can delete any message there.
Returns `true` on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to delete a Message, including service messages, with the following limitations: - A message can only be deleted if it was sent less than 48 hours ago.

def.name: delete_message
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int::Primitive | String) ? chat : chat.id
message_id = message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? message : message.id
request(Bool, "deleteMessage", {chat_id: chat_id, message_id: message_id})

instance_methods.name: edit_message_caption
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to edit captions of messages. On success,
if edited message is sent by the bot, the edited
`Message` is returned, otherwise `true`
is returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to edit captions of messages.
instance_methods.args_string: (chat, caption, message = nil, inline_message = nil, parse_mode = ParseMode::Normal, reply_markup = nil)

def.name: edit_message_caption
def.body:
if (!message) && (!inline_message)
  raise("A message_id or inline_message_id is required")
end
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int::Primitive | String) ? chat : chat.id
message_id = message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? message : message.id
inline_message_id = inline_message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? inline_message : inline_message.id
parse_mode = parse_mode == ParseMode::Normal ? nil : parse_mode.to_s
request(Bool | Message, "editMessageCaption", {chat_id: chat_id, caption: caption, message_id: message_id, inline_message_id: inline_message_id, parse_mode: parse_mode, reply_markup: reply_markup ? reply_markup.to_json : nil})

instance_methods.name: edit_message_live_location
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to edit live location messages. A location can be edited until
its live_period expires or editing is explicitly disabled by a call to
`#stopMessageLiveLocation`.

On success, if the edited message wasn't by the bot, the edited `Message` is
returned, otherwise `true` is returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to edit live location messages.

  raise("A message_id or inline_message_id is required")
end
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int::Primitive | String) ? chat : chat.id
message_id = message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? message : message.id
inline_message_id = inline_message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? inline_message : inline_message.id
request(Bool | Message, "editMessageLiveLocation", {chat_id: chat_id, latitude: latitude, longitude: longitude, message_id: message_id, inline_message_id: inline_message_id, reply_markup: reply_markup ? reply_markup.to_json : nil})

def.name: edit_message_media
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int::Primitive | String) ? chat : chat.id
media = check_open_local_file(media)
message_id = message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? message : message.id
inline_message_id = inline_message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? inline_message : inline_message.id
if (!message_id) && (!inline_message_id)
  raise("Either a message or inline_message is required")
end
request(Message, "editMessageMedia", {chat_id: chat_id, media: media, message_id: message_id, inline_message_id: inline_message_id, reply_markup: reply_markup})

Use this method to generate a new invite link for a chat; any previously
generated link is revoked. The bot must be an administrator in the chat

Returns the new invite link as `String` on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to generate a new invite link for a chat; any previously generated link is revoked.

instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to forward messages of any kind. On success,
the sent `Message` is returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to forward messages of any kind.

def.name: forward_message
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int::Primitive | String) ? chat : chat.id

from_chat_id = from_chat.is_a?(Int) ? from_chat : from_chat.id

instance_methods.name: get_chat
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to get up to date information about the chat
(current name of the user for one-on-one conversations,
current username of a user, group or channel, etc.).
Returns a `Chat` object on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get up to date information about the chat (current name of the user for one-on-one conversations, current username of a user, group or channel, etc.).

def.name: get_chat

instance_methods.name: get_chat_administrators
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to get a list of administrators in a chat. On success,
returns an `Array` of `ChatMember` objects that contains information
about all chat administrators except other bots. If the chat is a
group or a supergroup and no administrators were appointed,
only the creator will be returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get a list of administrators in a chat.

def.name: get_chat_administrators
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int::Primitive | String) ? chat : chat.id
request(Array(ChatMember), "getChatAdministrators", {chat_id: chat_id})

instance_methods.name: get_chat_member
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to get information about a member of a chat. Returns a
`ChatMember` object on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get information about a member of a chat.

def.name: get_chat_member
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int::Primitive | String) ? chat : chat.id
user_id = user.is_a?(Int) ? user : user.id
chat_member = request(ChatMember, "getChatMember", {chat_id: chat_id, user_id: user_id})
chat_member.chat_id = chat_id
chat_member

Use this method to get the number of members in a chat.
Returns `Int32` on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get the number of members in a chat.

instance_methods.name: get_file
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to get basic info about a file and prepare it for downloading.
For the moment, bots can download files of up to **20MB** in size. On success,
a `TFile` object is returned. The file can then be downloaded via the
link `https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>`, where
`<file_path>` is taken from the response. It is guaranteed that
the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link
expires, a new one can be requested by calling `#get_file` again.

To simplify retrieving a link for a file, use the `#get_file_link` method.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get basic info about a file and prepare it for downloading.

instance_methods.name: get_me
instance_methods.doc:
A simple method for testing your bot's auth token. Requires
no parameters. Returns basic information about the bot
in form of a `User` object.
instance_methods.summary: A simple method for testing your bot's auth token.

instance_methods.name: get_my_commands
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to get the current list of the bot's commands. Requires no parameters.
Returns Array of BotCommand on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get the current list of the bot's commands.

instance_methods.name: get_updates
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to receive incoming updates using long polling
([wiki](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Push_technology#Long_polling)).
An `Array` of `Update` objects is returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to receive incoming updates using long polling (wiki).
instance_methods.args_string: (offset = @next_offset, limit = 100, timeout = 0, allowed_updates = [] of String)

def.name: get_updates
def.body:
updates = request(Array(Update), "getUpdates", {offset: offset, limit: limit, timeout: timeout, allowed_updates: allowed_updates})
if !updates.empty?
  @next_offset = updates.last.update_id + 1
end
updates

Returns a `UserProfilePhotos` object.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get a list of profile pictures for a user.

def.name: get_user_profile_photos
def.body:
user_id = user.is_a?(Int) ? user : user.id
request(UserProfilePhotos, "getUserProfilePhotos", {user_id: user_id, offset: offset, limit: limit})

instance_methods.name: is_admin?
instance_methods.doc:
Convenience method to check if this bot is an admin in
the current chat. See `Client#get_chat_administrators`
for more info.

Note: This method should be used sparingly. It's much better to cache admins.
instance_methods.summary: Convenience method to check if this bot is an admin in the current chat.

def.name: is_admin?
def.body:
admins = get_chat_administrators(chat_id)
admins.any? do |a|
  a.user.id = @bot_info.id
end

instance_methods.name: kick_chat_member
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to kick a user from a group, a supergroup or a channel.
In the case of supergroups and channels, the user will not be able to
return to the group on their own using invite links, etc., unless
unbanned first. The bot must be an administrator in the chat
for this to work and must have the appropriate admin
rights. Returns `true` on success.

> Note: In regular groups (non-supergroups), this method will only work
> if the `All Members Are Admins` setting is off in the target group.
> Otherwise members may only be removed by the group's creator or
> by the member that added them.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to kick a user from a group, a supergroup or a channel.

def.name: kick_chat_member
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int::Primitive | String) ? chat : chat.id
user_id = user.is_a?(Int) ? user : user.id
if (until_date.is_a?(Int) || until_date.nil?)
else
  until_date = until_date.to_unix
end

instance_methods.name: poll
instance_methods.doc:
Start polling for updates. This method uses a combination of `#get_updates`
and `#handle_update` to send continuously check Telegram's servers
for updates.
instance_methods.summary: Start polling for updates.

def.name: poll
def.body:
self.delete_webhook
Log.info do
  "Polling for updates"
end
@polling = true
while @polling
  begin
    updates = get_updates
    updates.each do |u|
      handle_update(u)
    end
  rescue ex
    puts(ex.inspect_with_backtrace)
    Log.error(exception: ex) do
      "Error during polling"
    end
  end
end

Use this method when you need to tell the user that something is happening on the
bot's side. The status is set for 5 seconds or less (when a message arrives
from your bot, Telegram clients clear its typing status).
Returns `true` on success.

> Example: The ImageBot needs some time to process a request and upload the image.
> Instead of sending a text message along the lines of “Retrieving image, please
> wait…”, the bot may use `#sendChatAction` with action = upload_photo. The user
> will see a “sending photo” status for the bot.

We only recommend using this method when a response from the bot will take a
noticeable amount of time to arrive.

instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to send a native poll.
On success, the sent Message is returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to send a native poll.
instance_methods.args_string: (chat, question : String, options : Array(String), anonymous : Bool = true, type : Poll::Type = Poll::Type::Regular, allows_multiple_answers : Bool = false, correct_option_id : Int32? = nil, close_date : Time? = nil, open_period : Int32? = nil, closed : Bool = false, disable_notification : Bool = false, reply_to_message = nil, reply_markup = nil)

def.name: send_poll
def.body:
if options.size < 2 || options.size > 10
  raise("Incorrect option count. Expected 2-10, given #{options.size}.")
end
if options.any? do |o|
  o.size < 1 || o.size > 100
end
  raise("Incorrect option size. Poll options must be between 1 and 100 characters.")
end
if (type == Poll::Type::Quiz) && (!correct_option_id)
  raise("Quiz poll type requires a correct_option_id be set.")
end
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
if reply_to_message
  reply_to_message = reply_to_message.is_a?(Int) ? reply_to_message : reply_to_message.id
end
request(Message, "sendPoll", {chat_id: chat_id, question: question, options: options, anonymous: anonymous, type: type.to_s, allows_multiple_answers: allows_multiple_answers, correct_option_id: correct_option_id, close_date: close_date.try(&.to_unix), is_closed: closed, disable_notification: disable_notification, reply_to_message_id: reply_to_message, reply_markup: reply_markup})

instance_methods.name: serve
instance_methods.doc:
Start an HTTP server at the specified `host` and `port` that listens for
updates using Telegram's webhooks. This is the reccommended way to handle
bots in production.

Note: Don't forget to call `set_webhook` first! This method does not do it for you.
instance_methods.summary: Start an HTTP server at the specified host and port that listens for updates using Telegram's webhooks.
instance_methods.args_string: (host = "127.0.0.1", port = 8081, ssl_certificate_path = nil, ssl_key_path = nil, &block : HTTP::Server::Context -> )

def.name: serve
def.body:
server = HTTP::Server.new do |context|
  Fiber.current.telegram_bot_server_http_context = context
  begin
    block.call(context)
  rescue ex
    Log.error(exception: ex) do
      "Server error"
    end
  ensure
    Fiber.current.telegram_bot_server_http_context = nil
  end
end
if ssl_certificate_path && ssl_key_path
  fl_use_ssl = true
  ssl = OpenSSL::SSL::Context::Server.new
  ssl.certificate_chain = ssl_certificate_path.not_nil!
  ssl.private_key = ssl_key_path.not_nil!
  server.bind_tls(host: host, port: port, context: ssl)
else
  server.bind_tcp(host: host, port: port)
end
Log.info do
  "Listening for requests at #{host}:#{port}"
end
server.listen

instance_methods.name: serve
instance_methods.doc:
Start an HTTP server at the specified `host` and `port` that listens for
updates using Telegram's webhooks. This is the reccommended way to handle
bots in production.

Note: Don't forget to call `set_webhook` first! This method does not do it for you.
instance_methods.summary: Start an HTTP server at the specified host and port that listens for updates using Telegram's webhooks.
instance_methods.args_string: (path = "/", host = "127.0.0.1", port = 8081, ssl_certificate_path = nil, ssl_key_path = nil)

def.name: serve
def.body:
serve(host, port, ssl_certificate_path, ssl_key_path) do |context|
  if context.request.method == "POST"
  else
    next
  end
  if context.request.path == path
  else
    next
  end
  if body = context.request.body
    update = Update.from_json(body)
    handle_update(update)
  end
end

instance_methods.name: set_webhook
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to specify a url and receive incoming updates via an outgoing webhook.
Whenever there is an update for the bot, we will send an HTTPS POST request to the
specified url, containing a JSON-serialized `Update`. In case of an unsuccessful
request, we will give up after a reasonable amount of attempts.
Returns `true` on success.

If you'd like to make sure that the Webhook request comes from Telegram, we recommend
using a secret path in the URL, e.g. `https://www.example.com/<token>`. Since nobody
else knows your bot‘s token, you can be pretty sure it’s us.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to specify a url and receive incoming updates via an outgoing webhook.

Log.info do

    " with certificate"
  end}"
end
request(Bool, "setWebhook", params)

types.name: Command
types.doc:
Define a new Command. By default all commands start with a `/` and
commands are accessable to all chat types. You can change these
defaults by supplying named parameters to the annotation.

Options:
- `commands` - the command(s) to use. should be a prefixless string or symbol.
- `prefix` - the prefix for this command. defaults to `/`.
- `remove_leading` - if true the `text` value passed to the command context will not include the command, if the command is at the beginning. defaults to `true`.
- `private_only` - if true this command will only be allowed inside of private chats.
- `group_only` - if true this command will only be allowed inside of groups.

Example:

```crystal
@[Command("help", prefix: "!", private_only: true)]
def help_command(client, update)
  update.message.not_nil!.reply("This is a help message")
end
```
types.summary: Define a new Command.

def.name: annotate

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (commands, prefix = nil, group = :default, async = true, private_only = false, group_only = false, admin_only = false, &block : Context -> )

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(commands, prefix, group, async, private_only, group_only, admin_only, &block) do |_arg0|
  yield _arg0
end
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: call
def.body:
if message = update.message
  if (text = message.text) || (text = message.caption)
    if private_only && (message.chat.type != "private")
      return
    end
    if (group_only || admin_only) && (message.chat.type == "private")
      return
    end
    if @admin_only
      if from = message.from
        admins = client.get_chat_administrators(message.chat.id)
        ids = admins.map do |__arg1|
          __arg1.user.id
        end
        if ids.includes?(from.id)
        else
          return
        end
      end
    end
    tokens = text.split(/\s+/, 2)
    if tokens.empty?
      return
    end
    command = tokens[0]
    text = tokens[1]? || ""
    if command.includes?("@")
      command, botname = command.split("@", 2)
      if botname == client.bot.username.to_s
      else
        return
      end
    end
    prefix_re = /^#{@prefixes.join('|')}/
    if command.match(prefix_re)
    else
      return
    end
    command = command.sub(prefix_re, "")
    if @commands.includes?(command)
    else
      return
    end
    context = Context.new(update, message, command, text, !(!botname))
    @proc.call(context)
    return true
  end
end

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (update : Update, message : Message, command : String, text : String, botname : Bool)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(update, message, command, text, botname)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: hash
instance_methods.doc:
Generates an `UInt64` hash value for this object.

This method must have the property that `a == b` implies `a.hash == b.hash`.

The hash value is used along with `==` by the `Hash` class to determine if two objects
reference the same hash key.

Subclasses must not override this method. Instead, they must define `hash(hasher)`,
though usually the macro `def_hash` can be used to generate this method.
instance_methods.summary: Generates an UInt64 hash value for this object.

instance_methods.doc:

This method must have the property that `a == b` implies `a.hash == b.hash`.

The hash value is used along with `==` by the `Hash` class to determine if two objects
reference the same hash key.

Subclasses must not override this method. Instead, they must define `hash(hasher)`,
though usually the macro `def_hash` can be used to generate this method.

def.name: from_message
def.body:
error = case text
when /chat not found/
  ChatNotFound
when /chat_id is empty/
  ChatIdIsEmpty
when /user_id_invalid/
  text = "Invalid user id"
  BotDomainInvalid
when /chat description is not modified/
  ChatDescriptionIsNotModified
when /query is too old and response timeout expired or query id is invalid/
  InvalidQueryID
when /PEER_ID_INVALID/
  text = "Invalid peer ID"
  InvalidPeerID
when /RESULT_ID_INVALID/
  text = "Invalid result ID"
  InvalidResultID
when /Failed to get HTTP URL content/
  InvalidHTTPUrlContent
when /BUTTON_URL_INVALID/
  text = "Button URL invalid"
  ButtonURLInvalid
when /URL host is empty/
  URLHostIsEmpty
when /START_PARAM_INVALID/
  text = "Start param invalid"
  StartParamInvalid
when /BUTTON_DATA_INVALID/
  text = "Button data invalid"
  ButtonDataInvalid
when /wrong file identifier\/HTTP URL specified/
  WrongFileIdentifier
when /group is deactivated/
  GroupDeactivated
when /Photo should be uploaded as an InputFile/
  PhotoAsInputFileRequired
when /STICKERSET_INVALID/
  text = "Sticker set is invalid"
  InvalidStickersSet
when /there is no sticker in the request/
  NoStickerInRequest
when /CHAT_ADMIN_REQUIRED/
  text = "Admin permissions are required"
  ChatAdminRequired
when /need administrator rights in the channel chat/
  text = "Admin permissions are required"
  NeedAdministratorRightsInTheChannel
when /not enough rights to pin a message/
  NotEnoughRightsToPinMessage
when /method is available only for supergroups and channel/
  MethodNotAvailableInPrivateChats
when /can't demote chat creator/
  CantDemoteChatCreator
when /can't restrict self/
  text = "Admin can't restrict self"
  CantRestrictSelf
when /not enough rights to restrict\/unrestrict chat member/
  NotEnoughRightsToRestrict
when /PHOTO_INVALID_DIMENSIONS/
  text = "Invalid photo dimensions"
  PhotoDimensions
when /supergroup members are unavailable/
  UnavailableMembers
when /type of file mismatch/
  TypeOfFileMismatch
when /wrong remote file id specified/
  WrongRemoteFileIdSpecified
when /PAYMENT_PROVIDER_INVALID/
  text = "Payment provider invalid"
  PaymentProviderInvalid
when /currency_total_amount_invalid/
  text = "Currency total amount invalid"
  CurrencyTotalAmountInvalid
when /HTTPS url must be provided for webhook/
  text = "Bad webhook: HTTPS url must be provided for webhook"
  WebhookRequireHTTPS
when /Webhook can be set up only on ports 80, 88, 443 or 8443/
  text = "Bad webhook: Webhook can be set up only on ports 80, 88, 443 or 8443"
  BadWebhookPort
when /getaddrinfo: Temporary failure in name resolution/
  text = "Bad webhoook: getaddrinfo: Temporary failure in name resolution"
  BadWebhookAddrInfo
when /failed to resolve host: no address associated with hostname/
  BadWebhookNoAddressAssociatedWithHostname
when /can't parse URL/
  CantParseUrl
when /unsupported URL protocol/
  UnsupportedUrlProtocol
when /can't parse entities/
  CantParseEntities
when /result_id_duplicate/
  text = "Result ID duplicate"
  ResultIdDuplicate
when /bot_domain_invalid/
  text = "Invalid bot domain"
  BotDomainInvalid
when /Method is available only for supergroups/
  MethodIsNotAvailable
when /method not found/
  MethodNotKnown
when /terminated by other getUpdates request/
  text = "Terminated by other getUpdates request; Make sure that only one bot instance is running"
  TerminatedByOtherGetUpdates
when /can't use getUpdates method while webhook is active/
  CantGetUpdates
when /bot was kicked from a chat/
  BotKicked
when /bot was blocked by the user/
  BotBlocked
when /user is deactivated/
  UserDeactivated
when /bot can't initiate conversation with a user/
  CantInitiateConversation
when /bot can't send messages to bots/
  CantTalkWithBots
when /message is not modified/
  text = "Bad request: message is not modified message content and reply markup are exactly the same as a current content and reply markup of the message"
  MessageNotModified
when /MESSAGE_ID_INVALID/
  MessageIdInvalid
when /message to forward not found/
  MessageToForwardNotFound
when /message to delete not found/
  MessageToDeleteNotFound
when /message text is empty/
  MessageTextIsEmpty
when /message can't be edited/
  MessageCantBeEdited
when /message can't be deleted/
  MessageCantBeDeleted
when /message to edit not found/
  MessageToEditNotFound
when /reply message not found/
  MessageToReplyNotFound
when /message identifier is not specified/
  MessageIdentifierNotSpecified
when /message is too long/
  MessageIsTooLong
when /Too much messages to send as an album/
  TooMuchMessages
when /wrong live location period specified/
  WrongLiveLocationPeriod
when /The group has been migrated to a supergroup with ID (\-?\d+)/
  match = text.match(/The group has been migrated to a supergroup with ID (\-?\d+)/)
  id = match.not_nil![1].to_i64
  return MigrateToChat.new(id)
when /retry after (\d+)/
  match = text.match(/retry after (\d+)/)
  seconds = match.not_nil![1].to_i
  return RetryAfter.new(seconds)
else
  Error
end
error.new(text)

def.name: format_html
def.body:
available = entities.dup opened = [] of MessageEntity result = [] of String | Char text.chars.each_index do |i| loop do index = available.index do |e| e.offset == i end if index.nil? break end entity = available[index] case entity.type when "bold" result << "" when "italic" result << "" when "code" result << "" when "pre" if entity.language result << "
"
      else
        result << "
"
      end
    when "strikethrough"
      result << ""
    when "underline"
      result << ""
    when "text_mention"
      if user = entity.user
        result << ""
      end
    when "text_link"
      result << ""
    end
    opened.unshift(entity)
    available.delete_at(index)
  end
  result << text[i]
  loop do
    index = opened.index do |e|
      ((e.offset + e.length) - 1) == i
    end
    if index.nil?
      break
    end
    entity = opened[index]
    case entity.type
    when "bold"
      result << ""
    when "italic"
      result << ""
    when "code"
      result << ""
    when "pre"
      result << "
"
    when "strikethrough"
      result << ""
    when "underline"
      result << ""
    when "text_mention"
      if entity.user
        result << ""
      end
    when "text_link"
      result << ""
    end
    opened.delete_at(index)
  end
end
result.join("")

Base builder class for `InlineKeyboardMarkup::Builder` and
`ReplyKeyboardMarkup::Builder`.

def.name: build_keyboard
def.body:
if columns < 2
  return buttons.map do |b|
    [b]
  end
end
wrap_fn = wrap ? wrap : ->(_btn : T, _index : Int32, current_row : Array(T)) do
  current_row.size >= columns
end
result = [] of Array(T)
current_row = [] of T
buttons.each_with_index do |btn, index|
  if wrap_fn.call(btn, index, current_row)
    result << current_row.dup
    current_row.clear
  end
  current_row << btn
end
if current_row.size > 0
  result << current_row
end
result

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a new `PaginatedKeyboard`, yielding the newly created keyboard to the block

## Arguments
- `results` - the initial set of results
- `per_page` - the number of results to show on each page
- `header` - text to be displayed above the results
- `footer` - text to be displayed below the results
- `prefix` - a string to be added to the beginning of each item
- `back_text` - text to use for the back button
- `next_text` - text to use for the next button
- `id` - an id to be used both as the `group` name, and the prefix for the callback query data

# Formatting
The params `header`, `footer`, and `prefix` are formatted prior to being injected into the message.
- `{page}` - will be replaced with the current page number, starting at 1
- `{page count}` - will be replaced with the total number of pages
- `{index}` - for `prefix` only, gets replaced with the index of the current item, starting at 1
constructors.summary: Creates a new PaginatedKeyboard, yielding the newly created keyboard to the block
constructors.args_string: (results = [] of String, per_page = 10, &block : self -> )

yield instance

def.name: current_page
def.body:
if pages[@current_page]?
else
  return ""
end
String.build do |str|
  if header
    str.puts(format_text(header.to_s))
  end
  pages[@current_page].each_with_index do |item, i|
    str.puts((format_text(prefix.to_s, i + 1)) + item)
  end
  if footer
    str.puts(format_text(footer.to_s))
  end
end

to be saved as they're seen, and then provide a way for both
to be fetched by either id or username.

```crystal
bot = MyBot.new(API_KEY, persistence: Tourmaline::JsonPersistence.new)

if user = bot.persistence.get_user?("foobar")

end
```

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a `String` representation of this enum member.
In the case of regular enums, this is just the name of the member.
In the case of flag enums, it's the names joined by vertical bars, or "None",
if the value is zero.

If an enum's value doesn't match a member's value, the raw value
is returned as a string.

```
Color::Red.to_s                     # => "Red"
IOMode::None.to_s                   # => "None"
(IOMode::Read | IOMode::Write).to_s # => "Read | Write"

Color.new(10).to_s # => "10"
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns a String representation of this enum member.

types.name: RoutedMenu
types.doc:
The `RoutedMenu` helper class offers a simple to use DSL for creating
menus, potentially with multiple levels. Includes support for HTTP
like routing, route history, back buttons, and more.

Routes are hashed and shortened before being sent, which means you have
no need to worry about the typical 65 character callback query data limit.

Example:
```
MENU = RoutedMenu.build do
  route "/" do
    content "Some content to go in the home route"
    buttons do
      route_button "Next page", "/page_2"
    end
  end

  route "/page_2" do
    content "..."
    buttons do
      back_button "Back"
    end
  end
end

# in a command
send_menu(chat_id, MENU)
```
types.summary: The RoutedMenu helper class offers a simple to use DSL for creating menus, potentially with multiple levels.

new(builder.routes, starting_route)

def.body:
hash = OpenSSL::MD5.hash(route)
min_len = Math.min(49, hash.size - 1)
hash.to_slice[..min_len].hexstring

def.name: handle_button_click
def.body:
if (message = ctx.query.message) && (match = ctx.match)
  route = match[1]
  if (route.downcase.strip("/")) == "back"
    if @route_history.size > 1
      route_history.pop
      route = route_history.pop
    else
      return ctx.query.answer("No page to go back to")
    end
  end
  if page = @routes[route]?
    @current_route = route
    route_history << route
    message.edit_text(page.content, reply_markup: page.buttons, parse_mode: page.parse_mode)
    ctx.query.answer
  else
    ctx.query.answer("Route not found")
  end
end

instance_methods.name: update_id
instance_methods.doc:
The update‘s unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain
positive number and increase sequentially. This ID becomes especially
handy if you’re using Webhooks, since it allows you to ignore
repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence,
should they get out of order. If there are no new updates
for at least a week, then identifier of the next update
will be chosen randomly instead of sequentially.

instance_methods.doc: Returns all users included in this update as a Set

def.name: users
def.body:
users = [] of User | ::Nil
[self.channel_post, self.edited_channel_post, self.edited_message, self.message].compact.each do |message|
  if message
    users.concat(message.users)
  end
end
if query = self.callback_query
  users << query.from
  if message = query.message
    users.concat(message.users)
  end
end
[self.chosen_inline_result, self.shipping_query, self.inline_query, self.pre_checkout_query].compact.each do |e|
  if e.from
    users << e.from
  end
end
[self.poll_answer].compact.each do |e|
  if e.user
    users << e.user
  end
end
users.compact.uniq!

types.name: UpdateAction
types.doc:
The available event types for `EventHandler`. `UpdateAction`s can
be retrieved from an `Update` using `.from_update`.
types.summary: The available event types for EventHandler.

def.name: from_update
def.body:
actions = [] of UpdateAction
actions << UpdateAction::Update
if message = update.message
  actions << UpdateAction::Message
  if message.reply_message
    actions << UpdateAction::ReplyMessage
  end
  if chat = message.chat
    if chat.pinned_message
      actions << UpdateAction::PinnedMessage
    end
  end
  if message.text
    actions << UpdateAction::Text
  end
  if message.audio
    actions << UpdateAction::Audio
  end
  if message.document
    actions << UpdateAction::Document
  end
  if message.photo.size > 0
    actions << UpdateAction::Photo
  end
  if message.sticker
    actions << UpdateAction::Sticker
  end
  if message.video
    actions << UpdateAction::Video
  end
  if message.voice
    actions << UpdateAction::Voice
  end
  if message.contact
    actions << UpdateAction::Contact
  end
  if message.location
    actions << UpdateAction::Location
  end
  if message.venue
    actions << UpdateAction::Venue
  end
  if message.new_chat_members.size > 0
    actions << UpdateAction::NewChatMembers
  end
  if message.left_chat_member
    actions << UpdateAction::LeftChatMember
  end
  if message.new_chat_title
    actions << UpdateAction::NewChatTitle
  end
  if message.new_chat_photo.size > 0
    actions << UpdateAction::NewChatPhoto
  end
  if message.delete_chat_photo
    actions << UpdateAction::DeleteChatPhoto
  end
  if message.group_chat_created
    actions << UpdateAction::GroupChatCreated
  end
  if message.migrate_from_chat_id
    actions << UpdateAction::MigrateToChatId
  end
  if message.supergroup_chat_created
    actions << UpdateAction::SupergroupChatCreated
  end
  if message.channel_chat_created
    actions << UpdateAction::ChannelChatCreated
  end
  if message.migrate_from_chat_id
    actions << UpdateAction::MigrateFromChatId
  end
  if message.game
    actions << UpdateAction::Game
  end
  if message.video_note
    actions << UpdateAction::VideoNote
  end
  if message.invoice
    actions << UpdateAction::Invoice
  end
  if message.successful_payment
    actions << UpdateAction::SuccessfulPayment
  end
  if message.connected_website
    actions << UpdateAction::ConnectedWebsite
  end
  if message.passport_data
    actions << UpdateAction::PassportData
  end
  if message.poll
    actions << UpdateAction::Poll
  end
  if message.via_bot
    actions << UpdateAction::ViaBot
  end
  if dice = message.dice
    if dice.emoji == "🎲"
      actions << UpdateAction::Dice
    end
    if dice.emoji == "🎯"
      actions << UpdateAction::Dart
    end
    if dice.emoji == "🏀"
      actions << UpdateAction::Basket
    end
  end
end
if update.edited_message
  actions << UpdateAction::EditedMessage
end
if update.channel_post
  actions << UpdateAction::ChannelPost
end
if update.edited_channel_post
  actions << UpdateAction::EditedChannelPost
end
if update.inline_query
  actions << UpdateAction::InlineQuery
end
if update.chosen_inline_result
  actions << UpdateAction::ChosenInlineResult
end
if update.callback_query
  actions << UpdateAction::CallbackQuery
end
if update.shipping_query
  actions << UpdateAction::ShippingQuery
end
if update.pre_checkout_query
  actions << UpdateAction::PreCheckoutQuery
end
if update.poll
  actions << UpdateAction::Poll
end
if update.poll_answer
  actions << UpdateAction::PollAnswer
end
actions

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a `String` representation of this enum member.
In the case of regular enums, this is just the name of the member.
In the case of flag enums, it's the names joined by vertical bars, or "None",
if the value is zero.

If an enum's value doesn't match a member's value, the raw value
is returned as a string.

```
Color::Red.to_s                     # => "Red"
IOMode::None.to_s                   # => "None"
(IOMode::Read | IOMode::Write).to_s # => "Read | Write"

Color.new(10).to_s # => "10"
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns a String representation of this enum member.

types.name: UpdateContext
types.doc:
Context provided to each update. This context allows filters
to pass information to the handler without modifying the
`Update` object. It can be accessed with `update.context`
and works in much the same way as `JSON::Any` and
`Log::Context`.
types.summary: Context provided to each update.

instance_methods.doc:
Assumes the underlying value is an `Array` or `Hash`
and returns the element at the given *index_or_key*.

Raises if the underlying value is not an `Array` nor a `Hash`.
instance_methods.summary: Assumes the underlying value is an Array or Hash and returns the element at the given index_or_key.

def.body:
case object = @raw
when Array
  if index_or_key.is_a?(Int)
    object[index_or_key]
  else
    raise("Expected int key for Array#[], not #{object.class}")
  end
when Hash
  object[index_or_key]
else
  raise("Expected Array or Hash, not #{object.class}")
end

instance_methods.doc:
Assumes the underlying value is an `Array` or `Hash` and returns the element
at the given *index_or_key*, or `nil` if out of bounds or the key is missing.

Raises if the underlying value is not an `Array` nor a `Hash`.
instance_methods.summary: Assumes the underlying value is an Array or Hash and returns the element at the given index_or_key, or nil if out of bounds or the key is missing.

def.body:
case object = @raw
when Array
  if index_or_key.is_a?(Int)
    object[index_or_key]?
  else
    nil
  end
when Hash
  object[index_or_key]?
else
  raise("Expected Array or Hash, not #{object.class}")
end

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (action : UpdateAction, group = :default, async = true, &block : Update -> )

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(action, group, async, &block) do |_arg0|
  yield _arg0
end
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: call
def.body:
actions = UpdateAction.from_update(update)
if actions.includes?(@action)
  if @async
    spawn(@proc.call(update))
  else
    @proc.call(update)
  end
  true
end
